To relieve hunger and thirst.

To accumulate more and more,

In the past, there was a country
called Xianti.
At that time, there was an elder bhikṣu
who was chronically ill, emaciated, and filthy.
He was lying in the Xianti monastery
without anyone to attend to him.
The Buddha, together with five hundred bhikṣus,
went to his place
and had the bhikṣus take turns to care for him.
They made him rice gruel.
But the bhikṣus, upon smelling the foul odor,
all despised him.
The Buddha had Indra fetch him hot water.
The Buddha, with his vajra hand,
washed the sick bhikṣu's body.
The earth then shook and suddenly became brightly illuminated.
Everyone was awestruck.
The king of the country, the ministers and people, devas, nāgas, ghosts and spirits,
countless people went to where the Buddha was.
He bowed his head to the Buddha's feet and said:
The Buddha is the World-Honored One.
There is no equal in the three realms.
His virtue and Way are complete.
Why would he stoop to wash a sick bhikṣu?
The Buddha told the king and the assembly:
The reason the Tathāgata appears in the world
is precisely for those who are poor, suffering, and without protection.
Making offerings to sick śramaṇas and practitioners,
as well as the poor, orphaned, and elderly,
has immeasurable blessings and will fulfill one's wishes.
One will surely attain the Way.
The king said to the Buddha:
What offenses did this bhikṣu commit in his past life?
He has been suffering from illness for many years and cannot be cured.
The Buddha told the king:
In the past, there was a king
named Evil Conduct.
His governance was strict and harsh.

They will become a child of merit for others.
They will not be taken advantage of by evil ghosts.
The family lineage will be powerful.

original: 是故應修福善幡燈功德。

Moreover, if the four groups of men and women,
At the time of death or after passing away,
On the day of their death,
Make yellow banners and hang them on the top of the stupa.
May they obtain blessings and virtues and be free from the suffering of the eight difficulties.
They will be reborn in the pure lands of the Buddhas in the ten directions.
Make offerings of banners and canopies.
According to one's wishes, up to attaining enlightenment.
As the banners turn with the wind,
they become tattered and completely destroyed, down to becoming tiny dust particles.
The wind blows the dust particles, and the blessings are immeasurable.
When the banner turns once, it turns the position of the wheel-turning king.
Down to the position of a small king blown by the dust.
The rewards are immeasurable.
The forty-nine lamps illuminate the dark hells.
If sentient beings in pain are illuminated by this light,
they will all be able to see each other.

original: 緣此福德拔彼眾生皆得休息。

Offenses committed on the previous fast days of the eight kings.

Using blessings to grant amnesty.
Arriving at the later fast day.

Moreover, the Sutra on the Fruits of Past Vows says:
In the past, there was a Brahmin couple.
They had no children.
Their wealth was countless.
When they were about to die, they said to each other:
We should each swallow money as our provisions.
The local custom in that country was not to bury the dead.
They were only placed under trees.
Each swallowed fifty gold coins.
When their bodies rotted, the coins came out.

original: 國中有一賢者。🔽行見愍之泫然流淚。
analyzed: 國中有一賢者。 行見愍之泫然流淚。
translated: There was a wise person in the country.🔽Seeing this, he felt pity and tears flowed down.
He felt sorry for their stinginess and greed, and took it as a blessing.
He invited the Buddha and the Sangha.
He used everything to make offerings and held the food in front of the Buddha.
He praised the Buddha's name and made a vow.
At that time, the stingy couple experienced the suffering of hungry ghosts.
They were then reborn in the heavens and invited the four groups.
At that time, the one who was reborn in the heavens
Immediately attained the heavenly eye and knew that they were making merit.
From the heavens, he transformed into a young man
And assisted the donor.

original: 佛言此厨間年少是真檀越。
analyzed: 佛言此厨間年少是真檀越。
translated: The Buddha said, This young man in the kitchen is the true donor.
The Buddha spoke the Dharma for him and he attained the path of the stream-enterer.

The assembly of monks rejoiced and all attained rebirth in the heavens.
Moreover, the Hundred Parables Sutra says:
In the past, there was a merchant who wanted to enter the great ocean.
He needed a guide.
He went together with them to seek and found a guide.
They set out together and reached a vast wilderness.
There was a heavenly temple.
It was necessary to sacrifice a person before they could pass through.
Then the merchants discussed together, saying:
We are all relatives.
How can we kill each other?
Only this guide can be used to sacrifice to the heavens.
They then killed the guide and used him to make a sacrifice.
After the sacrifice to heaven was completed,
they lost their way and did not know where to go.
They died of exhaustion and despair.
All worldly people are also like this.
If they want to enter the ocean of Dharma to obtain its precious treasures,
they should cultivate good conduct as their guide.
If they destroy good conduct,
they will be on the long road of birth and death forever without a way out.
They will experience the three paths of suffering for a long time.
It is like those merchants who are about to enter the ocean.
They kill their guide.
They lose their way and cannot cross.
In the end, they will die of exhaustion.
